intro: Osbeckia wattii, commonly known as the New Zealand osbeckia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant features small, white to pale blue flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Osbeckia wattii is often found in coastal and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
